moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. c3 g6 4. d4: I figured he'd play this move at some point.
moves.4... cxd4 5. cxd4: Yes, he does have a classical center. *But* I haven't yet moved my central Pawns, so I can use them at my leisure to break it down, in Hypermodern style.
moves.5... Bg7 6. d5 Ne5: No point in retreating when I can centralize my Knight nicely.
moves.7. Nc3 e6: My brother saw a tactical opportunity to deprive me of the castling privilege -- but, as the Queens come off the board in the process, it will make it harder for him to exploit this with an attack. His Q will be gone and his Rooks stuck in the corners.
moves.8. dxe6 dxe6 9. Qxd8+ Kxd8 10. Bf4: If he had played B-N5 ch, I was prepared to move my King again, but he elected this move instead. Now I seize a tactical chance to make his King remain exposed even if he does castle by breaking up his K-side Pawns.
moves.10... Nxf3+ 11. gxf3 Ne7 12. Bb5: I can't let this B command this diagonal, so...
moves.12... a6 13. Ba4 b5: Now he's cut off and forced to retreat.
moves.14. Bb3 Bb7 15. Rd1+: O-O-O ch may have been better, as the K could eventually seek shelter behind the 2 Q-side Pawns.
moves.15... Ke8 16. Bc2 Rc8: Activating *one* Rook. Both KR's are still relatively useless.
moves.17. Bd2 f5 18. Bb1 Kf7: Now my Rooks are connected and I can activate my KR, plus my K is in as safe a position as exists on my side of the board.
moves.19. Rc1 Rhd8 20. Bg5 Bxc3+ 21. bxc3: In return for the minor exchange, I cripple kid bro's Pawn position. With the endgame stage on us, I feel it's worth it.
moves.21... Rd7 22. O-O Rdc7: Focusing my fire on the weakling.
moves.23. Bd2 e5 24. Rfd1 f4: Restricting his QB's freedom of movement.
moves.25. a3 Ng8: I was going to reposition this Knight, but my kid bro, on the defensive, decided to play for a draw...
moves.26. Ba2+ Kg7 27. Bxg8 Kxg8: ...by creating an ending with opposite-colored Bishops.
moves.33. Kg1 Rb7 34. h3 h5 35. Kg2 Kg7 36. Kh: Draw agreed. I can't see any way to force a breakthrough, as he can blockade on the dark squares and with OCB's I have no way to counter it.
